alert.note: Alert for Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 6:55PM CDT until May 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL WASHITA...NORTHWESTERN CADDO...EASTERN CUSTER... SOUTHWESTERN BLAINE AND SOUTHEASTERN DEWEY COUNTIES... At 655 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles east of Arapaho, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Thomas, Hydro, Arapaho, Custer City, Bridgeport and Fay. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
